instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
threads.message:
Hi, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with liquid damage, does not detect audio devices. No input/output devices found. I can't find out what the problem is. There was serious damage around the <CHIP>U3300</CHIP>, and I had to put in several bridges to power the L6611 and <RESISTOR>R6610</RESISTOR>.Maybe something in the layers themselves is hurt!? I'm asking for help.
LG

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
threads.message:
U330 is not related with audio device; is just power switch for SD Card.

Check for corrosion <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>/01 area.
No audio devices at all on System Report?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
threads.message: There is no sound at startup, the system does not detect any audio devices. Power supply feeds 4.5v in on the audio codec chip. To be sure, I replaced the <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>/01. I think everything is present in <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
threads.message:
I expect some small resistors, or coils corroded.
Check inlcuding for corroded traces.
Check all powers around audio codec and its reset signal too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio devices.
threads.message:
I solved the problem - the motherboard is rubbish. 
I found that the connection was broken with <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>-<RESISTOR>R6211</RESISTOR> / <SIGNAL>HDA_SDIN0</SIGNAL>. 
Thanks for the help.
